results.title: The Force of gravity [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Our attempt to understand gravitation, especially in its relation to cosmology and geophysics; the views of the Egyptians and the Greeks, the later work of Copernicus, Kepler, Galileo and Newton and modern methods of studying and measuring gravity in different parts of the earth’s surface, with an explanation of the effect of the moon’s gravitational pull on the earth.

results.title: The Forbidden forest: a portrait of five teen fathers
results.brief_description: Five young men from Alberta, Canada, talk openly about becoming teen fathers. They discuss the difficulties they face on a range of issues from increased responsibilities, change of life and community attitude to their role as young fathers. The young men discuss how their predicament forced them to address the question of what they want out of life. These young men, accepting their responsibilities, answer questions relating to morals, life choices, youth lifestyle, friendship, jobs, education and career.

results.title: The Foolish frog
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, William Bernal and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of a Pete Seeger Folk-song about a farmer who witnesses a bullfrog falling into the mud and makes up a catchy song about it. Soon the whole town is singing it. When the frog hears the popular song about himself he explodes with pride, imparting a valuable lesson to all. Buoyant illustrations seem to dance along the screen.

results.title: The Followers
results.creator_credit: Gilles Blais, Jacques Bobet, Georges Dufaux and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Filmed mainly at the Montreal community of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness, this film revolves around three young Quebecers, Michel, Robert and Johane, from their first days in the temple to their initiation six months later. The film examines the family life of Krishna members, the active proselytising in the streets, the temple rituals, and the role of women and their reliance on men for spiritual guidance. This film affords a close look at one of the controversial new religious organisations to have emerged from the Sixties in the United States. An English version of a French film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gilles Blais, Jacques Bobet, Georges Dufaux and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Fogbrook Thing (K)
results.creator_credit: Mark Osborne and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Set in the mid-Sixties, this film accompanies Peter Young on his first camping trip with the Boy Scouts - deep into the bush, into a place of myths and folklore and fearful adventures. (ATOM Award 1987).

results.title: The Fog of war
results.creator_credit: Errol Morris, Michael Williams, Julie Bilson Ahlberg, Search Films and Radical Media
results.brief_description: Outstanding documentary from iconic filmmaker Errol Morris about Robert S. McNamara, Secretary of Defence in the United States government during the Kennedy and early Johnson years, who oversaw US involvement in the Vietnam war. McNamara is a fascinating and worthy subject, not only for his wry and articulate tales but also for his amazing experiences, as a key figure in the US government in the 20th century, and as head of the World Bank for thirteen years. Morris inter-cuts the interviews with stunning archival footage, recorded White House conversations and with poetically rendered images that relay the poignancy, sadness and tragedy of war. Haunting score by Phillip Glass. Academy Award winner, Best Documentary Feautre, 2003.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Errol Morris, Michael Williams, Julie Bilson Ahlberg, Search Films and Radical Media

results.title: The Flying turtle
results.brief_description: Herman the Turtle, determined to learn how to fly, takes lessons from a greedy eagle. Herman finally gets a pair of wings after plummeting to his death and going to heaven. Animated by Gil Turner, Cecil Surry and Robert Bentley. Music by Clarence Wheeler.

results.title: The Flying man
results.brief_description: An experimental animated film in which one man flies and another man, in an attempt to imitate him, fails. Uses water colors. Story by Stan Hayward and music by Ron Goodwin. (Award: Grand Prix, Annecy Festival, 1963)
